QuestionBankConfig.QuestionBankDatas:
1 <类型>MultipleChoice</类型> <题号>1</题号> <子题号>1</子题号> <分数>1</分数> <图标>hzhsqs</图标> <题头>Please choose the romantic features of the first stanza.（multiple choices）</题头> <阅读>I wandered lonely as a cloud 
 That floats on high o’er vales and hills 
 When all at once I saw a crowd,
 host, of golden daffodils; 
 Besides the lake, beneath the trees, 
 Fluttering and dancing in the breeze.</阅读> <解析>With a melancholy mood, the speaker makes a striking contrast between the lonely cloud and the vivid daffodils. Nature inspires poetry. The speaker humanizes the daffodils when he says they are engaging in a dance. |说话者将自己比作一朵流云，用流云的孤寂反衬出水仙花的生机盎然。自然是诗歌的灵感源泉，当水仙花翩翩起舞时，说话者赋予自然以生命力。</解析> <选择>浪漫主义色彩1:Subjectivism: The description of natural objects is modified by the poet’s feelings.</选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩2:Spontaneity: The role of instinct, intuition, and the feeling of “the heart” is stressed. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩3:Singularity: It has a strong love for the remote, the supernatural, the mysterious, the splendid and the picturesque. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩4:Worship of nature: The poet reads in nature some mysterious force. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩5:There is a dominating note of solitude and melancholy. </选择> <答案>0</答案> <答案>4</答案> <答案解析></答案解析> <提示>浪漫主义色彩1, 5</提示>

2 <类型>MultipleChoice</类型> <题号>1</题号> <子题号>2</子题号> <分数>1</分数> <图标>hzhsqs</图标> <题头>Please choose the romantic features of the second stanza. （multiple choices）</题头> <阅读>Continuous as the stars that shine 
 And twinkle on the Milky Way, 
 They stretched in never-ending line 
 Along the margin of a bay: 
 Ten thousand saw I at a glance, 
 Tossing their heads in sprightly dance.</阅读> <解析>In the heart of poet, daffodils are no longer just a plant. It has become a messenger of God and a spiritual embodiment. It is this kind of spirit that rejoices the original melancholy heart. Here “continuous”and “never-ending” may suggest that the flowers leave an everlasting impact on Wordsworth. |在诗人的心中, 水仙已不再是单单一种植物, 它成了神的使者，一种精神的化身。正是这种精神令原来本低沉忧郁的心灵变得欢欣鼓舞。 在这里“continuous”和“never-ending”暗示水仙花给他留下了永恒的影响。</解析> <选择>浪漫主义色彩1:Subjectivism: The description of natural objects is modified by the poet’s feelings.</选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩2:Spontaneity: The role of instinct, intuition, and the feeling of “the heart” is stressed. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩3:Singularity: It has a strong love for the remote, the supernatural, the mysterious, the splendid and the picturesque. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩4:Worship of nature: The poet reads in nature some mysterious force. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩5:There is a dominating note of solitude and melancholy. </选择> <答案>2</答案> <答案>3</答案> <答案解析></答案解析> <提示>浪漫主义色彩3, 4</提示>

3 <类型>MultipleChoice</类型> <题号>1</题号> <子题号>3</子题号> <分数>1</分数> <图标>hzhsqs</图标> <题头>Please choose the romantic feature of the third stanza.</题头> <阅读>The waves beside them danced; but they 
 Outdid the sparking waves in glee: 
 A poet could not but be gay, 
 In such a jocund company! 
 I gazed – and gazed – but little thought 
 What wealth the show to me had brought.</阅读> <解析>The poet stares at the daffodils lingeringly, without yet realizing the complete extent of the positive effects of encountering them. Even when the poet calls for the original emotion of “returning to nature”, he does not forget the relative independence of himself and nature. |诗人久久凝望，却想象不到这奇景赋予了他多少精神财富。即使诗人在深情地呼唤 “回归自然”的原始情感时,也没有忘记自我与自然的相对独立性。</解析> <选择>浪漫主义色彩1:Subjectivism: The description of natural objects is modified by the poet’s feelings.</选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩2:Spontaneity: The role of instinct, intuition, and the feeling of “the heart” is stressed. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩3:Singularity: It has a strong love for the remote, the supernatural, the mysterious, the splendid and the picturesque. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩4:Worship of nature: The poet reads in nature some mysterious force. </选择> <选择>浪漫主义色彩5:There is a dominating note of solitude and melancholy. </选择> <答案>1</答案> <答案解析></答案解析> <提示>浪漫主义色彩2</提示>

4 <类型>MultipleChoice</类型> <题号>2</题号> <分数>1</分数> <图标>hzhsqs</图标> <题头>Choose two lines from the following items that demonstrate the force of daffodils .（multiple choices）</题头> <选择>A.Ten thousand saw I at a glance”(line 11)</选择> <选择>B.“For oft, when on my couch I lie”(line 19) </选择> <选择>C.“I wandered lonely as a cloud”(line 1)</选择> <选择>D.“A poet could not but be gay ”(line 15)</选择> <答案>0</答案> <答案>3</答案> <答案解析></答案解析> <提示>正确答案：A, D</提示>

5 <类型>MultipleChoice</类型> <题号>3</题号> <分数>1</分数> <图标>hzhsqs</图标> <题头>“Daffodil” stands for________（multiple choices）</题头> <阅读></阅读> <解析></解析> <选择>A.the beauty of nature that may heal and give strength to body and soul alike</选择> <选择>B.the embodiment of happiness </选择> <选择>C.a virtual image that has a temporary impact on poet’s mind</选择> <答案>0</答案> <答案>1</答案> <答案解析>For the poet, nature is the object that reflects man’s observation and thinking. In order to find genuine self, man must rely on the power of nature, which could purify man’s soul and find his existence. |对于诗人来说自然是主体进行观察、反映的客体。人要寻找真正的自己需借助自然的力量。因为大自然能使人类的灵魂得到净化，并找到其自身的存在。</答案解析> <提示>正确答案：A, B</提示>

6 <类型>MultipleChoice</类型> <题号>4</题号> <分数>1</分数> <图标>nvyk</图标> <题头>Walking and wandering in daffodils, the poet transcends the reality and encounters his genuine self. Why?（multiple choices）</题头> <解析></解析> <选择>A.In the poet’s mind, daffodil is not only a plant, but a symbol which represents a spirit.</选择> <选择>B.Walking and wandering make the poet pay much more attention to the interaction between nature and himself.</选择> <选择>C.The cheerful daffodils mirror the poet himself and his desire.</选择> <答案>0</答案> <答案>1</答案> <答案>2</答案> <提示>正确答案：A, B, C</提示>

10 <类型>MultipleChoice</类型> <题号>5</题号> <分数>1</分数> <图标></图标> <题头>Sure. Sure. There are several meanings, such as _____（multiple choices）</题头> <阅读></阅读> <解析></解析> <选择>A.to emphasize the identity of American people</选择> <选择>B.to create new words</选择> <选择>C.to create a smooth rhythm</选择> <选择>D.to imply the poet himself</选择> <答案>0</答案> <答案>2</答案> <答案>3</答案>

16 <类型>MultipleChoice</类型> <题号>6</题号> <分数>2</分数> <图标></图标> <题头>There are 39“I”in“Tian Gou”, what’s the connotation of“I”? |在该诗中，“我”出现了39次，该词的内涵是什么呢？</题头> <阅读></阅读> <选择>A.The lighting（闪电）</选择> <选择>B.Guo Moruo（郭沫若)</选择> <选择>C.Human beings（人类）</选择> <选择>D.The ship（船只） </选择> <答案>1</答案> <答案>2</答案>

7 <类型>SingleChoice</类型> <题号>1</题号> <分数>2</分数> <阅读>结庐在人境，而无车马喧。
 问君何能尔？心远地自偏。
 采菊东篱下，悠然见南山。
 山气日夕佳，飞鸟相与还。
 此中有真意，欲辨已忘言。</阅读> <图标>tym</图标> <题头>你能想到为何这首诗中的“悠然见南山”一句，用的是“见”，而不是“望”吗？</题头> <阅读>yinjiuqi5.txt</阅读> <选择>A.“见”是无意中的偶见，悠然自得，合成物我两忘的“无我之境”。如果用“望”字，便是心中先有南山，才有意去望，成了“有我之境”。</选择> <选择>B.“见”是看见之意，诗人在采菊时若有所思地欣赏南山的美景。而“望”好像是在说诗人极目远眺南山，与自然美景产生了距离感。</选择> <答案>0</答案>

8 <类型>SingleChoice</类型> <题号>2</题号> <分数>2</分数> <阅读>The waves beside them danced; but they 
 Outdid the sparking waves in glee: 
 A poet could not but be gay, 
 In such a jocund company! 
 I gazed – and gazed – but little thought 
 What wealth the show to me had brought:</阅读> <图标>hzhs</图标> <题头>Since you have mentioned the choice of words, Mr. Wordsworth, the use of ‘gaze’in this poem seems to have a special meaning , what does it mean? |既然提到这个，在您的诗中用了gaze一词，似乎带有一种特别的意蕴，这背后代表了什么吗？</题头> <阅读>iwanderedlonelyasacloud.txt</阅读> <选择>A、Mr.Wordsworth constantly gazes at the daffodils, which reflects his curiosity about nature and his strong desire to find the secrets of nature.</选择> <选择>B、Mr.Wordsworth constantly gazes at the daffodils, which reflects his strong desire for happiness and eternal spirit and his longing to find out the meaning of life.</选择> <答案>1</答案>

9 <类型>SingleChoice</类型> <题号>3</题号> <分数>2</分数> <图标></图标> <题头>For Tao Yuanming, the relationship between man and nature is______. |陶渊明认为人与自然的关系是______</题头> <阅读></阅读> <解析></解析> <选择>A、subordinate</选择> <选择>B、equal</选择> <答案>1</答案> <答案解析>The journey in Wordsworth’s former residence is over. Hope you have a good memory. And please start your next journey! |您好，今天在华兹华斯故居游览完毕，希望你在这次旅程中留下美好回忆，请开启下一段旅程。</答案解析>

11 <类型>FillInTheBlank</类型> <题号>1</题号> <子题号>1</子题号> <分数>1</分数> <图标></图标> <题头>I celebrate _____, and sing myself, </题头> <解析></解析> <选择>me</选择> <选择>parents</选择> <选择>energy</选择> <选择>myself</选择> <选择>you </选择> <答案>3</答案> <答案解析>Whitman himself</答案解析>

12 <类型>FillInTheBlank</类型> <题号>1</题号> <子题号>2</子题号> <分数>1</分数> <图标></图标> <题头>For every atom belonging to___ as good belongs to ___. </题头> <解析></解析> <选择>me</选择> <选择>parents</选择> <选择>energy</选择> <选择>myself</选择> <选择>you </选择> <答案>0</答案> <答案>4</答案> <答案解析>the close relationship between you and me. |你和我的密切关系。</答案解析>

13 <类型>FillInTheBlank</类型> <题号>1</题号> <子题号>3</子题号> <分数>1</分数> <图标></图标> <题头>Born here of parents born here from ___the same, and their parents the same， </题头> <解析></解析> <选择>me</选择> <选择>parents</选择> <选择>energy</选择> <选择>myself</选择> <选择>you </选择> <答案>1</答案> <答案解析>American fellows. |美国同胞。</答案解析>

14 <类型>FillInTheBlank</类型> <题号>1</题号> <子题号>4</子题号> <分数>1</分数> <图标></图标> <题头>Nature without check with original ________. </题头> <解析></解析> <选择>me</选择> <选择>parents</选择> <选择>energy</选择> <选择>myself</选择> <选择>you </选择> <答案>2</答案> <答案解析>the nature, the universal vitality. |自然和宇宙生命力</答案解析>

17 <类型>FillInTheBlank</类型> <题号>2</题号> <分数>2</分数> <图标></图标> <题头>This line tells that every life, including human beings, animals and plants, originates from the same energy that makes every creature equal. It implies a spirit of________（democracy/ monarchy） |每一个生命，无论是人类，动物或者植物都来自于能量，正是能量使得万物平等。诗行体现了______精神(民主精神/君主专制)</题头> <阅读></阅读> <选择>democracy</选择> <选择>monarchy</选择> <答案>0</答案>

18 <类型>FillInTheBlank</类型> <题号>3</题号> <分数>2</分数> <图标></图标> <题头>For Whitman, men and women, the white and the black, the rich and the poor, the honoured and the despised are equal. Everyone is different. The view of democracy, advocated by Whitman, highlights the role of _______(the individual/ the collective). |惠特曼把男女，白人黑人，富人和穷人，受尊敬的人与被鄙视的人置于同样的地位。他们每一个人都有自己独特的个性。所以，惠特曼所倡导的民主是重点强调________（个人/集体）, 这种民主将会放大个体的存在。</题头> <阅读></阅读> <选择>the individual</选择> <选择>the collective</选择> <答案>0</答案>

19 <类型>FillInTheBlank</类型> <题号>4</题号> <分数>2</分数> <图标></图标> <题头>“Light”and “Energy” stand for a kind of collective power. Therefore, Guo Moruo emphasizes the role of _________(the individual/ the collective) in this poem. |“光”与“能量”代表了一种集体的力量，因此，郭沫若在这首诗中更加强调_________(个人/集体)的力量</题头> <阅读></阅读> <选择>the individual</选择> <选择>the collective</选择> <答案>1</答案>

20 <类型>Summary</类型> <图标></图标> <题头>The happy journey is about to end, what have you learned? Could you write a short passage of democracy? (about 50 words, Chinese or English ). |旅行将要结束，你学习到了什么？你能写一篇有关民主精神的小短文吗？50字左右，中英文皆可。</题头> <阅读></阅读>
